rooms.description: A combined living and dining space that integrates Scandinavian minimalist design with functional modern furniture. The area features a central Scandinavian coffee table, light wood finishes, neutral colors, and ample natural light streaming from large windows following Vastu principles of inviting positive energy. A dedicated area for dining is set aside near the north wall to align with auspicious directions.

The master bedroom features a Scandinavian aesthetic with clean lines and light wood tones, ensuring ample storage space and integrated wardrobes. The room includes a built-in workspace corner for multifunctional use. A spacious balcony is designed adjacent to the window on the east side, providing an outdoor retreat while aligning with Vastu guidelines for restful energy.

This secondary bedroom area includes built-in seating and integrated storage solutions. Scandinavian design is maintained through the use of muted color palettes, light wood elements, and functional furniture. The room has its own balcony on the west side to maintain a balance between indoor space and open views as per Vastu principles.

A compact but efficient Scandinavian kitchenette that maximizes storage and workflow. The design includes modern fixtures, natural light from strategically placed openings near the south wall for positive energy flow as per Vastu guidelines.

A functional Scandinavian bathroom with minimalist fixtures, ample storage, and a glass sliding door to maintain a sense of spaciousness. The placement follows Vastu principles ensuring proper drainage and ventilation.

openings.description: Large windows placed strategically to allow ample natural light, enhance ventilation, and maintain Scandinavian aesthetics while adhering to Vastu guidelines for energy flow.

The main door is positioned in a favorable direction as per Vastu, ensuring the positive ingress of energy into the apartment. It features minimalistic design elements consistent with Scandinavian style.
